blocks.text: The armoury of the Tricorn is a cathedral to violence. Rows upon rows of weapons hang on racks behind armoured glass — lasguns, bolt weapons, exotic xenos artifacts sealed behind stasis fields. Enough firepower to wage a small war, which, you suppose, is precisely the point.

Interrogator Lira stands at a requisition terminal, her storm coat exchanged for operational gear — form-fitting carapace armor under a grey bodyglove, a bolt pistol at her hip, and a razor-thin power sword across her back. She looks born for this.

The Inquisitor has authorized standard field loadout for you. Take what you need, but remember — we're going into the underhive, not the Eye of Terror. Subtlety serves us better than firepower. At least initially.
blocks.speaker: Interrogator Lira

blocks.text: Drax is already geared up — carapace armor, shotgun, shock maul, and enough ammunition to hold off a small WAAAGH!. He catches your eye and deliberately chambers a round. The message is clear.

The Magos has provided each team member with a micro-vox and an auspex-link. Data feeds will be relayed to Macharius in real-time. Additionally, the following tactical approaches have been calculated for operational effectiveness.
blocks.speaker: Magos Rhyn-7

blocks.text: The tech-priest projects three tactical overlays onto the armoury's display screen, each showing a different route into Subsector Morwen-9.
[SYSTEM] Choose your approach. This decision will determine how Chapter 2 begins and what challenges you face. Choose wisely — the underhive does not forgive poor planning.

choices.text: [INFILTRATION] Go in disguised. Blend with the underhive population, gather intelligence quietly.
[INVESTIGATION] Use Inquisitorial authority openly. Demand cooperation from local enforcers and informants.
[PSYCHIC TRACKING] Follow the Warp-traces directly. Your powers will guide you where conventional methods cannot.
"Drax. I want you at my six, not behind me watching. We work together or we die alone."
